item.description:
This is part of the Jewish Film Festival. You are responsible for getting your own ticket but we can go together and eat dinner there. Please see the flyer from the Temple where it is being held.


Temple Beth Abraham of Canton, MA

Presents

The Showing of its Fall Jewish Movie Festival

Featuring The Film,

"The Yankles"

This comedy is about a washed-up baseball player

who begrudgingly becomes the manager of a team of

college-age Yeshiva students who want to learn the

game to eventually play on the intercollegiate circuit.

A winner of many awards, "The Yankles" is a

feel-good picture that will have you laughing and

clapping. It all takes place on Sunday, October 14th.

Doors open at 6pm and the film begins at 6:30pm.

A light supper and snacks will be available at our

concession stand.

Cost is: $10 for advance tickets.

$15 at the door.

Please call the Temple Office at 781-828-5250

or email your reservation at

theoffice@templebethabraham.org
item.name: Let's go to Dale's Cousin's Movie, "The Yankles"
